intro: Salaxis octandra, commonly known as the yellow salaxis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, orange-yellow flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant has opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves that are typically oval in shape. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Salaxis octandra is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
